title: Phansad Wildlife Sanctuary
subtitle: A coastal forest paradise rich in biodiversity near Alibaug
overview: Phansad Wildlife Sanctuary, located between Murud and Roha in Raigad district, is a hidden ecological gem of the Konkan coast. Spread over 52 square kilometers, it preserves the semi-evergreen coastal forest ecosystem of the Western Ghats.

This sanctuary shelters over 700 plant species, 150 bird species, 30 mammals, and a rich variety of butterflies and reptiles. It’s an ideal spot for nature lovers, photographers, and eco-tourists seeking peace away from city life.
Once a private hunting reserve of the Nawab of Murud-Janjira, Phansad now thrives as a protected area promoting conservation and responsible tourism.

highlights.title: Dense Forest Trails
highlights.description: Walk through lush evergreen forests filled with unique flora and fauna.

highlights.title: Birdwatching Haven
highlights.description: Home to hornbills, paradise flycatchers, and many endemic bird species.

geography.intro: Phansad lies between Murud and Roha towns in Raigad district, covering both hilly and coastal forest regions.

details.label: Terrain
details.value: Hilly forest interspersed with plateaus and grasslands

details.label: Rivers/Streams
details.value: Khajinja and Kulsadi streams flow through the forest

climate.description: Phansad experiences a humid tropical climate with heavy monsoon rains and mild winters.

seasons.text: Monsoon: June to September — lush and green but limited access

geography.conclusion: Phansad offers a rare mix of coastal forest, wildlife, and peaceful eco-trails — perfect for a weekend nature escape.

activities.title: Birdwatching
activities.description: Spot over 150 species including hornbills and drongos.

activities.title: Forest Trekking
activities.description: Explore multiple eco-trails through thick forest and grassland patches.
info: Guided treks available from sanctuary office
Carry water and wear sturdy shoes

activities.title: Wildlife Photography
activities.description: Capture scenic landscapes and vibrant wildlife species.
info: Permits may be required for professional gear

attractions.title: Sable Machi Trail
attractions.description: A scenic trekking route inside the sanctuary leading to a viewpoint.

attractions.title: Pond Ecosystem
attractions.description: Natural ponds where animals gather to drink and birds nest nearby.

marineLife.intro: Although inland, Phansad’s proximity to the Konkan coast creates a blend of marine and terrestrial ecosystems.

items.title: Amphibians & Reptiles
items.description: Tree frogs, monitor lizards, and snakes thrive in the humid environment.

items.title: Butterflies & Insects
items.description: Home to colorful butterflies like the Blue Mormon and Southern Birdwing.

conclusion: Phansad forms an ecological bridge between marine and forest ecosystems.
It supports rare reptiles, insects, and birds vital to the Konkan biodiversity chain.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: 120 km from Mumbai via Alibaug and Roha
Private taxis or MSRTC buses available up to Murud

howToReach.title: By Train
details: From Roha, take taxi or local bus to sanctuary

bookingTips.description: Visit during winter or early summer for the best forest experience
Entry permits available at the sanctuary gate; nominal fees apply
Photography permitted; separate charge for professional cameras
